author: Anthony Zurkster
comment: Simple and functional, no buggy advertising. Recommend.

author: Festus Aniteye
comment: IT Is a help when phone is not in usw.

author: Valerie R. Coffman
comment: Phone says it is installed but it didnt show up on my watch.

author: Elmar Karimov
comment: Thanks for the revolution

author: sant gupta
comment: Nice

author: F I
comment: Great app. Easy to use and quick. Voice recognition feature is a little funky, but then again it relies on external API, so this is not the app's fault.  One thing that the app can really benefit from - adding a % on the front page, to calculate/add/subtract the percentage, as in regular calculators. Another 'nice to have' feature would be to have a memory add/view/clear buttons (on the next page, if necessary).

author: Jeff N
comment: I tried the gesture calculator and hated it. You had to go on two screens for every operation. This was much simpler and I love the voice commands. I was going to make a request to have you push and hold the clear button to clear the answer but then I tested it and that actually worked. All very well done. I like being able to say go Google launch calculator but I am going to forget that word launch. It would be nice if just the word calculator worked.
title: Wonderfully simple and easy

author: Matthew Clark
comment: Works well and the voice control is a neat idea. My only gripe is the interface colour, it's not the same as in the images.... more brown... it would be nice if there was a choice... I'd go with black.
title: It's a calculator on your wrist....

author: Niel H
comment: Just about as good as a car with a blind driver, or taking a picture with the lens cap on... you get the idea. Turns out I had another app with a hidden button that overlapped the = button on this app, so I was retarded and thought the calculator's = button was broken. Every time I hit the = button nothing happened, but its because the hidden button was blocking it. I changed the size of the hidden button and now we're good to go. No hard feelings? ;-)

reply.author: Wearable Software
reply.content:
What do you mean with broken equals button? Please further describe the problem.
Write an email to support@wearable-software.com. Please review again. Thanks.

title: What good is reviewer that doesn't know his own watch?

author: Michael Wilson
comment: What more do you want? It does what a calculator is meant to do. I can never understand why Android Wear people complain about the watches & the apps because they don't allow you to time travel or find the cure for cancer. Jeesh, it's early tech & they are just basic extensions of your smart phone. Get over it people!
title: All Good

author: Jeroen Debois
comment: Great app to do some quick simple calculations on your watch, but you can also do more 'advanced' calculations by swiping to the right. Besides that there is a possibility for voice input.
title: Does what you except from it.. And more

author: Jonathon Keefer
comment: Phone: Samsung Galaxy Note Edge.         Watch: Asus ZenWatch.                      Every attempt to open the app from my ZenWatch, the app says "Calculator has stopped working". Hoping to see this fixed and I will change my rating. :-)
title: Not Working

author: Matthew McNair
comment: Works very well on my Moto 360. The only thing I would change is that I would prefer my wear apps to not leave an entry in my phone app drawer unless it has settings or something attached. A stub that is just full of links to the play store is kinda pointless.
title: Works great!

author: Richard Harrison
comment: Just will not open on Samsung Gear Live with my Galaxy Note Edge. Opens it on phone which is useless. Need tech support to explain please.
title: Just will not open

author: Brandon Nyman
comment: It works nicely and looks and feels nice on my moto 360 however I'd like the / to be changed to ÷ and * to X and I tried the voice input but it mucked up and would not calculate. Then it was forever trying to calculate it And I couldn't do anything else on it or stop it so I uninstalled and re installed. Other than that it is good.
title: Nice but voice input caused it to stop working

author: Michael Hawthorne
comment: A bit fiddly at first and will take time to work out the input order but already after 5 min's I have a few in the bag. The voice input is good but again will take time to master.
title: Great idea

comment: I appreciate the work that went into this smartwatch app. I use it on a Moto 360 2nd gen. The problem I experience is the 'C' button does not clear the entry. Can this be fixed?
title: Overall good. One bug.

author: Jessi Walsh
comment: This app is actually pretty decent the one downfall is that after you hit the equal button and go to input a new set of numbers the old total does not automatically clear. You have to manually clear the previous total which means hitting the clear key for each individual number. There needs to be a fix for this.
title: Okay, with one downfall

author: Nick C.
comment: Very useful little app to have on your watch, especially when Google's voice recognition is a bit hit and miss (or you just don't want to talk to your watch). Looks great too and works well on my G Watch R. If I had one *minor* quibble it's that I'd prefer the size of the numbers of the readout to match the keys (i.e. a little bit bigger) but no drama. Thanks for making this available.
title: Very useful

author: David Biesack
comment: This calculator has a strange user experience. For example, after pressing = the next digit will *append* to the previous result rather than clearing and starting a new input. Thus the button sequence 5 * 35 = 4 * 17 = does not result in 175 then 68. Instead it results in 175 then 29818 (that is, 175 then 1754 * 17 = 29818.)  So if you are used to other calculators, you need to learn to use clear after each = result with this calculator when you want to start a new calculation. This behavior may be OK once you get used to it, but again it is different from just about any calculator I've ever used. This is why I only rated this a 3 - I think it degrades from usability.  I discovered that a long press on the 'C' (clear) button will clear the entire display, and a quick click on 'C' will only remove one digit. It's also a little strange (to me) that pressing 'C' once will also remove a digit from a *result*, so be careful - you can alter a result without realizing it.  Unlike other calculators for Android Wear, 1/3*3 results in 1, not 0.999999.  I would prefer to see multiplication represented with the standard 'X' button label, not '*'.
title: An odd calculator

author: Alex Burns
comment: Interface could be improved slightly... Just made to look a little more stylish. I am nit picking though as it does everything it needs to do.
title: Nice

author: Quiet -
comment: I use a calculator some time on my job it is a pain trying to pull my phone out to use it so I got this app very handy for moto 360.  The  plus and minus buttons etc  are a little small other than  that great  app
title: Great App

author: Chad Niemi
comment: Works as intended. Haven't used the voice piece yet, but will update if I do. Seems good enough for doing "maths".
title: It's a calculator!

comment: For those of us old enough to remember, the original "smart" watches had calculators... And whilst I may have acceptable mathematics skills, a calculator still comes in handy from time-to-time. Calculator for Android Wear restores the calculator functionality "from the glory days", looks great and works well. Definitely recommended.
title: Essential Android Wear application.

author: Peter Gallacher
comment: Layout is nice and clean. Thankfully no icon is left on the phone ether so I'm very happy about that.
title: Perfect, it calculates math for me!

author: Alisha Higginbotham
comment: Simple and easy to use! Not very touch sensitive, but I am thinking that's because the watch screen is so small.

author: Greg Humlicek
comment: Virus software and company!  They installed an app on my phone without me knowing!  Stay away from this app and "Wearable Software"!  Holy cow I am pissed.

author: Paul McClure
comment: Make it to where you can allow us to slide down from the number keyboard to see our calculation history. That would make the app even better!
title: I have a suggestion that would make it even better!

author: Igor Treyger
comment: Please please please add the % function! We all need to calculate tips once in a while.. Also,  it'd be nice to leave the equation on the screen with the result,  not just the result itself.  Do that and you've got yourself a 5!

author: Wes Gergely
comment: It appears the app gets hidden from the app drawer after you post a rating...woulda been nice to know that...been staring at the app drawer app on my phone for months now taking up space.  Once I rated it it went away.  Woot woot!
title: Mention this

author: Mike Cutmore
comment: Nice useful app. Works like a dream. Always wanted a calculator watch since the '80s. This is a must have on watch. Seemed to use existing android calculator on phone when no other icons were evident but recent update has now fixed all other issues. Overall a nice job (Moto 360).
title: Great

author: shreyas khandekar
comment: It's a good app considering the world is still adjusting to the idea of smart watches. Would have been a five star if it had more available functions  , like more than the sin ,cos, tan and all.
title: Nice enough for daily use

author: Bryce G
comment: What is there to say? It's a calculator for android wear with some scientific functions as well as support for parentheses and multiple operations at once. Having a calculator on my wrist has proven useful in the past and surely will do so in the future.

author: John Laws
comment: Nothing to fancy but it works in a pinch. Thanks for good application just what I needed. J. Laws
title: Simple calculator

author: David Friedman
comment: Sporadically unresponsive to touch. Voice worked once, then went off into eternal spinner land.  Samsung Gear Live
title: Doesn't work well.

author: Pete Graybash
comment: "22/7+14" results in a spinner and then accepts no input. Can we have an option to turn off voice input (hide the microphone) until this is a little less alpha?
title: voice seems a little bit... broken

author: David Dahlberg
comment: Cool app that works great. One of the few on my Moto 360 that I actually use because I need to use it and not just because I can. Would be sooo awesome if it got a material design inspired look as well. At least as an option.
title: Clean and functional

author: Brandon Dilbeck
comment: If I type numbers after getting a result, the numbers are appended to the end of the previous result instead of first clearing the screen. Calculator needs to clear the result if the user types a number after =. Does well following the order of operations and easy to type despite the small screen.

author: Kay Burn Lim
comment: How can percentages not be on this but more advanced functions are?
title: Please add %

author: droopie
comment: It's OK. More options but voice input would freeze the app from time to time
title: Lg g watch
